name: Salt Flats & Processing Belt
role_in_state: Primary salt & provisioning hub for maritime trade
economy_niches: Fish salting, curing and long-term preservation
Storage, drying and staging of imported ritual reagents
Ship provisioning and low-draft lightering services
culture_adjustments: Work-oriented, day-shift guild rhythms over long-voyage rites
Lower prestige for open-sea captains; higher for master coopers and processors
Frequent seasonal migrant labor; multilingual pockets in estuary hubs
Practical ritual use focused on preservation and spoilage-prevention
Contract-heavy dispute culture; oath-letters and tally-systems common
constraints: Ritual processes consume scarce imported reagents
notes: Linear province along estuary; production timed to low-spring tides
Guilds control most processing stages and export permits
Salt levies are a major state revenue stream
